title: Laz language
summary: The Laz language (ლაზური ნენა, lazuri nena; Georgian: ლაზური ენა, lazuri ena, or ჭანური ენა, ç̌anuri ena / ch’anuri ena) is a Kartvelian language spoken by the Laz people on the southeastern shore of the Black Sea.[4] It is estimated that there are around 20,000[5] native speakers of Laz in Turkey, in a strip of land extending from Melyat to the Georgian border (officially called Lazistan until 1925), and about 2,000 in Georgia.[5]
